intro: Barleria glaucobracteata, commonly known as the blue bract barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and have a bluish-green hue. Its flowers are small, tubular, and clustered in dense spikes, often displaying shades of blue or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
